1// -*- C++ -*-
2// CLASSDOC OFF
3// ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
4// CLASSDOC ON
5//
6// This file is a part of the CLHEP - a Class Library for High Energy Physics.
7//
8// This is the definition of the HepLorentzRotation class for performing
9// Lorentz transformations (rotations and boosts) on objects of the
10// HepLorentzVector class.
11//
12// HepLorentzRotation is a concrete implementation of Hep4RotationInterface.
13//
14// .SS See Also
15// RotationInterfaces.h
16// ThreeVector.h, LorentzVector.h
17// Rotation.h, Boost.h
18//
19// .SS Author
20// Leif Lonnblad, Mark Fischler
21
22#ifndef HEP_LORENTZROTATION_H
23#define HEP_LORENTZROTATION_H
24
25#ifdef GNUPRAGMA
26#pragma interface
27#endif
28
29#include "CLHEP/Vector/RotationInterfaces.h"
30#include "CLHEP/Vector/Rotation.h"
31#include "CLHEP/Vector/Boost.h"
32#include "CLHEP/Vector/LorentzVector.h"
33
34namespace CLHEP {
35
36// Global methods
37
38inline HepLorentzRotation inverseOf ( const HepLorentzRotation & lt );
39HepLorentzRotation operator * (const HepRotation & r,
40 const HepLorentzRotation & lt);
41HepLorentzRotation operator * (const HepRotationX & r,
42 const HepLorentzRotation & lt);
43HepLorentzRotation operator * (const HepRotationY & r,
44 const HepLorentzRotation & lt);
45HepLorentzRotation operator * (const HepRotationZ & r,
46 const HepLorentzRotation & lt);
47
48/**
49 * @author
50 * @ingroup vector
51 */
52class HepLorentzRotation {
53
54public:
55 // ---------- Identity HepLorentzRotation:
56
57 DLL_API static const HepLorentzRotation IDENTITY;
58
59 // ---------- Constructors and Assignment:
60
61 inline HepLorentzRotation();
62 // Default constructor. Gives a unit matrix.
63
64 inline HepLorentzRotation (const HepLorentzRotation & r);
65 // Copy constructor.
66
67 inline HepLorentzRotation (const HepRotation & r);
68 inline explicit HepLorentzRotation (const HepRotationX & r);
69 inline explicit HepLorentzRotation (const HepRotationY & r);
70 inline explicit HepLorentzRotation (const HepRotationZ & r);
71 inline HepLorentzRotation (const HepBoost & b);
72 inline explicit HepLorentzRotation (const HepBoostX & b);
73 inline explicit HepLorentzRotation (const HepBoostY & b);
74 inline explicit HepLorentzRotation (const HepBoostZ & b);
75 // Constructors from special cases.
76
77 inline HepLorentzRotation & operator = (const HepLorentzRotation & m);
78 inline HepLorentzRotation & operator = (const HepRotation & m);
79 inline HepLorentzRotation & operator = (const HepBoost & m);
80 // Assignment.
81
82 HepLorentzRotation & set (double bx, double by, double bz);
83 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const Hep3Vector & p);
84 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepRotation & r);
85 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepRotationX & r);
86 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepRotationY & r);
87 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepRotationZ & r);
88 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepBoost & boost);
89 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepBoostX & boost);
90 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepBoostY & boost);
91 inline HepLorentzRotation & set (const HepBoostZ & boost);
92 inline HepLorentzRotation (double bx, double by, double bz);
93 inline HepLorentzRotation (const Hep3Vector & p);
94 // Other Constructors giving a Lorentz-boost.
95
96 HepLorentzRotation & set( const HepBoost & B, const HepRotation & R );
97 inline HepLorentzRotation ( const HepBoost & B, const HepRotation & R );
98 // supply B and R: T = B R:
99
100 HepLorentzRotation & set( const HepRotation & R, const HepBoost & B );
101 inline HepLorentzRotation ( const HepRotation & R, const HepBoost & B );
102 // supply R and B: T = R B:
103
104 HepLorentzRotation ( const HepLorentzVector & col1,
105 const HepLorentzVector & col2,
106 const HepLorentzVector & col3,
107 const HepLorentzVector & col4 );
108 // Construct from four *orthosymplectic* LorentzVectors for the columns:
109 // NOTE:
110 // This constructor, and the two set methods below,
111 // will check that the columns (or rows) form an orthosymplectic
112 // matrix, and will adjust values so that this relation is
113 // as exact as possible.
114 // Orthosymplectic means the dot product USING THE METRIC
115 // of two different coumns will be 0, and of a column with
116 // itself will be one.
117
118 HepLorentzRotation & set( const HepLorentzVector & col1,
119 const HepLorentzVector & col2,
120 const HepLorentzVector & col3,
121 const HepLorentzVector & col4 );
122 // supply four *orthosymplectic* HepLorentzVectors for the columns
123
124 HepLorentzRotation & setRows( const HepLorentzVector & row1,
125 const HepLorentzVector & row2,
126 const HepLorentzVector & row3,
127 const HepLorentzVector & row4 );
128 // supply four *orthosymplectic* HepLorentzVectors for the columns
129
130 inline HepLorentzRotation & set( const HepRep4x4 & rep );
131 inline HepLorentzRotation ( const HepRep4x4 & rep );
132 // supply a HepRep4x4 structure (16 numbers)
133 // WARNING:
134 // This constructor and set method will assume the
135 // HepRep4x4 supplied is in fact an orthosymplectic matrix.
136 // No checking or correction is done. If you are
137 // not certain the matrix is orthosymplectic, break it
138 // into four HepLorentzVector columns and use the form
139 // HepLorentzRotation (col1, col2, col3, col4)
140
141 // ---------- Accessors:
142
143 inline double xx() const;
144 inline double xy() const;
145 inline double xz() const;
146 inline double xt() const;
147 inline double yx() const;
148 inline double yy() const;
149 inline double yz() const;
150 inline double yt() const;
151 inline double zx() const;
152 inline double zy() const;
153 inline double zz() const;
154 inline double zt() const;
155 inline double tx() const;
156 inline double ty() const;
157 inline double tz() const;
158 inline double tt() const;
159 // Elements of the matrix.
160
161 inline HepLorentzVector col1() const;
162 inline HepLorentzVector col2() const;
163 inline HepLorentzVector col3() const;
164 inline HepLorentzVector col4() const;
165 // orthosymplectic column vectors
166
167 inline HepLorentzVector row1() const;
168 inline HepLorentzVector row2() const;
169 inline HepLorentzVector row3() const;
170 inline HepLorentzVector row4() const;
171 // orthosymplectic row vectors
172
173 inline HepRep4x4 rep4x4() const;
174 // 4x4 representation:
175
176 // ------------ Subscripting:
177
178 class HepLorentzRotation_row {
179 public:
180 inline HepLorentzRotation_row(const HepLorentzRotation &, int);
181 inline double operator [] (int) const;
182 private:
183 const HepLorentzRotation & rr;
184 int ii;
185 };
186 // Helper class for implemention of C-style subscripting r[i][j]
187
188 inline const HepLorentzRotation_row operator [] (int) const;
189 // Returns object of the helper class for C-style subscripting r[i][j]
190
191 double operator () (int, int) const;
192 // Fortran-style subscripting: returns (i,j) element of the matrix.
193
194 // ---------- Decomposition:
195
196 void decompose (Hep3Vector & boost, HepAxisAngle & rotation) const;
197 void decompose (HepBoost & boost, HepRotation & rotation) const;
198 // Find B and R such that L = B*R
199
200 void decompose (HepAxisAngle & rotation, Hep3Vector & boost) const;
201 void decompose (HepRotation & rotation, HepBoost & boost) const;
202 // Find R and B such that L = R*B
203
204 // ---------- Comparisons:
205
206 int compare( const HepLorentzRotation & m ) const;
207 // Dictionary-order comparison, in order tt,tz,...zt,zz,zy,zx,yt,yz,...,xx
208 // Used in operator<, >, <=, >=
209
210 inline bool operator == (const HepLorentzRotation &) const;
211 inline bool operator != (const HepLorentzRotation &) const;
212 inline bool operator <= (const HepLorentzRotation &) const;
213 inline bool operator >= (const HepLorentzRotation &) const;
214 inline bool operator < (const HepLorentzRotation &) const;
215 inline bool operator > (const HepLorentzRotation &) const;
216
217 inline bool isIdentity() const;
218 // Returns true if the Identity matrix.
219
220 double distance2( const HepBoost & b ) const;
221 double distance2( const HepRotation & r ) const;
222 double distance2( const HepLorentzRotation & lt ) const;
223 // Decomposes L = B*R, returns the sum of distance2 for B and R.
224
225 double howNear( const HepBoost & b ) const;
226 double howNear( const HepRotation & r) const;
227 double howNear( const HepLorentzRotation & lt ) const;
228
229 bool isNear(const HepBoost & b,
230 double epsilon=Hep4RotationInterface::tolerance) const;
231 bool isNear(const HepRotation & r,
232 double epsilon=Hep4RotationInterface::tolerance) const;
233 bool isNear(const HepLorentzRotation & lt,
234 double epsilon=Hep4RotationInterface::tolerance) const;
235
236 // ---------- Properties:
237
238 double norm2() const;
239 // distance2 (IDENTITY), which involves decomposing into B and R and summing
240 // norm2 for the individual B and R parts.
241
242 void rectify();
243 // non-const but logically moot correction for accumulated roundoff errors
244 // rectify averages the matrix with the orthotranspose of its actual
245 // inverse (absent accumulated roundoff errors, the orthotranspose IS
246 // the inverse)); this removes to first order those errors.
247 // Then it formally decomposes that, extracts axis and delta for its
248 // Rotation part, forms a LorentzRotation from a true HepRotation
249 // with those values of axis and delta, times the true Boost
250 // with that boost vector.
251
252 // ---------- Application:
253
254 inline HepLorentzVector vectorMultiplication(const HepLorentzVector&) const;
255 inline HepLorentzVector operator()( const HepLorentzVector & w ) const;
256 inline HepLorentzVector operator* ( const HepLorentzVector & p ) const;
257 // Multiplication with a Lorentz Vector.
258
259 // ---------- Operations in the group of 4-Rotations
260
261 HepLorentzRotation matrixMultiplication(const HepRep4x4 & m) const;
262
263 inline HepLorentzRotation operator * (const HepBoost & b) const;
264 inline HepLorentzRotation operator * (const HepRotation & r) const;
265 inline HepLorentzRotation operator * (const HepLorentzRotation & lt) const;
266 // Product of two Lorentz Rotations (this) * lt - matrix multiplication
267
268 inline HepLorentzRotation & operator *= (const HepBoost & b);
269 inline HepLorentzRotation & operator *= (const HepRotation & r);
270 inline HepLorentzRotation & operator *= (const HepLorentzRotation & lt);
271 inline HepLorentzRotation & transform (const HepBoost & b);
272 inline HepLorentzRotation & transform (const HepRotation & r);
273 inline HepLorentzRotation & transform (const HepLorentzRotation & lt);
274 // Matrix multiplication.
275 // Note a *= b; <=> a = a * b; while a.transform(b); <=> a = b * a;
276
277 // Here there is an opportunity for speedup by providing specialized forms
278 // of lt * r and lt * b where r is a RotationX Y or Z or b is a BoostX Y or Z
279 // These are, in fact, provided below for the transform() methods.
280
281 HepLorentzRotation & rotateX(double delta);
282 // Rotation around the x-axis; equivalent to LT = RotationX(delta) * LT
283
284 HepLorentzRotation & rotateY(double delta);
285 // Rotation around the y-axis; equivalent to LT = RotationY(delta) * LT
286
287 HepLorentzRotation & rotateZ(double delta);
288 // Rotation around the z-axis; equivalent to LT = RotationZ(delta) * LT
289
290 inline HepLorentzRotation & rotate(double delta, const Hep3Vector& axis);
291 inline HepLorentzRotation & rotate(double delta, const Hep3Vector *axis);
292 // Rotation around specified vector - LT = Rotation(delta,axis)*LT
293
294 HepLorentzRotation & boostX(double beta);
295 // Pure boost along the x-axis; equivalent to LT = BoostX(beta) * LT
296
297 HepLorentzRotation & boostY(double beta);
298 // Pure boost along the y-axis; equivalent to LT = BoostX(beta) * LT
299
300 HepLorentzRotation & boostZ(double beta);
301 // Pure boost along the z-axis; equivalent to LT = BoostX(beta) * LT
302
303 inline HepLorentzRotation & boost(double, double, double);
304 inline HepLorentzRotation & boost(const Hep3Vector &);
305 // Lorenz boost.
306
307 inline HepLorentzRotation inverse() const;
308 // Return the inverse.
309
310 inline HepLorentzRotation & invert();
311 // Inverts the LorentzRotation matrix.
312
313 // ---------- I/O:
314
315 std::ostream & print( std::ostream & os ) const;
316 // Aligned six-digit-accurate output of the transformation matrix.
317
318 // ---------- Tolerance
319
320 static inline double getTolerance();
321 static inline double setTolerance(double tol);
322
323 friend HepLorentzRotation inverseOf ( const HepLorentzRotation & lt );
324
325protected:
326
327 inline HepLorentzRotation
328 (double mxx, double mxy, double mxz, double mxt,
329 double myx, double myy, double myz, double myt,
330 double mzx, double mzy, double mzz, double mzt,
331 double mtx, double mty, double mtz, double mtt);
332 // Protected constructor.
333 // DOES NOT CHECK FOR VALIDITY AS A LORENTZ TRANSFORMATION.
334
335 inline void setBoost(double, double, double);
336 // Set elements according to a boost vector.
337
338 double mxx, mxy, mxz, mxt,
339 myx, myy, myz, myt,
340 mzx, mzy, mzz, mzt,
341 mtx, mty, mtz, mtt;
342 // The matrix elements.
343
344}; // HepLorentzRotation
345
346inline std::ostream & operator<<
347 ( std::ostream & os, const HepLorentzRotation& lt )
348 {return lt.print(os);}
349
350inline bool operator==(const HepRotation &r, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
351 { return lt==r; }
352inline bool operator!=(const HepRotation &r, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
353 { return lt!=r; }
354inline bool operator<=(const HepRotation &r, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
355 { return lt<=r; }
356inline bool operator>=(const HepRotation &r, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
357 { return lt>=r; }
358inline bool operator<(const HepRotation &r, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
359 { return lt<r; }
360inline bool operator>(const HepRotation &r, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
361 { return lt>r; }
362
363inline bool operator==(const HepBoost &b, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
364 { return lt==b; }
365inline bool operator!=(const HepBoost &b, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
366 { return lt!=b; }
367inline bool operator<=(const HepBoost &b, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
368 { return lt<=b; }
369inline bool operator>=(const HepBoost &b, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
370 { return lt>=b; }
371inline bool operator<(const HepBoost &b, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
372 { return lt<b; }
373inline bool operator>(const HepBoost &b, const HepLorentzRotation & lt)
374 { return lt>b; }
375
376} // namespace CLHEP
377
378#include "CLHEP/Vector/LorentzRotation.icc"
379
380#endif /* HEP_LORENTZROTATION_H */
